title: The Nightly Show cancelled as ITV bring back News At Ten after the London terror attack
text:
The Nightly Show cancelled as ITV bring back News At Ten after the London terror attack ITV have changed their schedule across the evening to follow events at Westminster   Watch this video again Video will play in The Nightly Show viewers warm to Dermot O'Leary as they call for him host every week   
The Nightly Show has been cancelled this evening as ITV show an extended news bulletin on the London terror attacks. 
The late night chat show has been replaced by coverage from Westminster after today's shocking events, where one police officer was killed. 
Four people have reportedly died and others have been left with 'catastrophic injuries' after suspected terrorist activity. 
Dermot O'Leary was scheduled to host his third night of the show with actor Rupert Everett joining him on the sofa. Read More The Chase has been cancelled as ITV provide coverage of the London terror attack The Nightly Show has been cancelled this evening (Photo: ITV) 
The announcement was made after the end of Emmerdale that extended news coverage would air at 10pm instead. 
ITV's twitter account tweeted: "Due to the serious incidents in Westminster, there are changes to tonight's schedule. Extended @itvnews at 10pm. The regional news at 11pm." 
This isn't the first time ITV has changed its schedule today, as it replaced The Chase and Tipping Point for live scenes at the House of Parliament. Read More BBC changes schedule for The One Show and Pointless to show London terror attack coverage Dermot won't be on screen tonight (Photo: Rex Features) 
There was chaos outside the Houses of Parliament after a policeman was stabbed, the knifeman was shot and multiple pedestrians were mown down by a car in a suspected terrorist atrocity. 
There are reportedly at least four people dead after a car mounted the pavement and ploughed into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge at around 2.30pm today. 
The London Ambulance Service confirmed there were at least a dozen casualties. One woman was pulled from the River Thames after jumping off Westminster Bridge to dodge the car.
